title: ara.json defining an ARA package
description: Schema for a ARA package manifest. Used for discovery, installation, and configuration of AI development artifacts.

$schema.description: JSON Schema URI for this ara.json format

name.description: Package name in namespace/package-name format. Must contain exactly one forward slash separating namespace from package name.

version.description: Semantic version string (e.g., '1.0.0', '2.1.0-alpha'). Must follow semantic versioning format.

description.description: Human-readable explanation of package functionality. Should focus on capabilities, not implementation details.
description.example: AI agent for automated code review with support for multiple languages

author.description: Author email address for contact and attribution.

tags.description: Discovery tags for search and categorization. Use lowercase, hyphen-separated terms.

type.description: Package type determining installation and usage behavior. 'kiro-agent' for Kiro custom agent configurations, 'mcp-server' for MCP servers, 'context' for knowledge and prompt files, 'skill' for procedural knowledge via SKILL.md, 'kiro-powers' for MCP tools with steering files and hooks, 'kiro-steering' for persistent project knowledge, 'agents-md' for AGENTS.md format.

items.description: File or directory path relative to package root

files.description: Package files to include. If omitted, all files in the package directory are included.

repository.description: Source repository URL for browsing and contributing.

dependencies.description: Package dependencies with version constraints. Keys are package names in namespace/package-name format.

sources.description: Installation sources for MCP server packages. Only valid when type is 'mcp-server'. Clients attempt sources in order, preferring those marked with 'preferred: true'.

type.description: Source type indicating how to install the package

package.description: Package identifier in the source registry (npm, pypi, mcp-registry)

version.description: Package version. Must be a specific version, not a range.

registry.description: Registry URL. Defaults to the public registry for the source type.

repository.description: Git repository URL. Required for git source type.

ref.description: Git ref (tag, branch, or commit hash). Used with git source type.

subfolder.description: Subfolder within the repository for monorepo structures. Used with git source type.

installCommand.description: Build command to run after cloning. Used with git source type.

executable.description: Path to executable after build. Used with git source type.

preferred.description: Mark this source as preferred. Clients attempt preferred sources first.

sources.description: Installation sources for this MCP server
sources field is only allowed for mcp-server type
